title: is being too high to play the game properly a re-portable offense?
body: i reported her. She said she was high and i have no doubt she was. im so pissed. really hate playing with supports who are jsuts there to feed with incompetence. its not support. its a lead weight i have to carry. and the champions they pick. jfc just pick soraka.

replies.body:
report for assisting enemy team or non sportsman like conduct and quote her saying that she is high. Then add reason as making your life harder cause of her choices. As long as you have the right reasoning of how her choices IRL are effecting you as a player it should be a valid report. 

Its not enough for a ban, unless this player has a history.
i reported intentional feeding because drunks slamming into cars is manslaughter or something. also unsportsmanlike. assisting team is valid i feel.

Kinda an iffy area, as there's no telling how well people play video games while not sober. I just had a game with a jungler/ADC duo that bragged about how coked out they were, and it was one of the smoother games I've played in a while. Was your support actively bad, or were you just tilted by their admission of being high?

That said, you didn't mention if this was a reg or ranked, but I think it'd be pretty shifty to get messed up for a ranked match. That's just wrong.

her first three ultimates were a mile away and days late. Its like she would just do it and then literally nothing. no on enemy team would even react to it.

as to if i was tilted. yes i was playing draven and i am this close to tilting on that champion no matter what.
Why leave a comment like that? Does it make you happy to be toxic?

I have played with drunk, high, and dumb players. I would take the high ones any day lol. Have you ever seen a drunk Ahri? Most hilarious thing I have ever seen. She kept trying to charm her own team. 

What does it matter though? It's only a game. I'm pretty sure that you just posted this to rage and not for actual input, but I will leave you with this. Cannabis is decriminalized in several states. Odds are you have played quite a few games with high people. Chances are also good that you have played against quite a few high people.

Is it bannable? I would think not. I don't see a place on my PC to take a breathalyzer or piss test before I can queue. 

TL;DR {{item:3078}}  changes have had a higher impact on your in game QOL than high players have.

"too high to play the game properly" 
" really hate playing with supports who are just there to feed with incompetence"

1. There is no proper way to play the game. It's a game, everyone has their own ways and ideas of how things should be.
2. It's not there fault they're incompetent. But let me ask you this, why are you guys at the same elo if they're incompetent, and you're not?
3. The best way to get stronger is to carry "lead weight" for example, in real life if you wanna train your muscles you don't just lift your hands up and down. You pick up a weight. and you lift that weight up several times. Learn to pick up that dead weight and carry it, and you will become a better player

If im 4/1/1 draven 10 minutes into the game and yet overall my team is loosing 7 to 22, then its not realistic for me to carry that game without a competent support.

"properly playing league of legends" can be defined as landing skills, doing dmg, avoiding needless deaths, among optional other things.If you want to argue with that statement be noone's guest and just gtfo the gameplay boards.

forget about everything else in the game. Not every game will be that way.
Focus on your own game play and how you could have the most impact.

Also 7 to 22? that's a death every 2 minutes per person other than yourself.
Yeah....Not every game will be that bad lol. 
You can use the worse case scenario as an example for what you need to carry.

yes. and then when you go to 13 minutes into the game  because i dont have an exact timestamp of when this was in the game, then the numbers become more believable. no i didnt mark the time that the score got perfectly to 7-22, but it was long before 20 min. yes. bbronze feeds at a rate of 1+ kills per minute.

Stoned or what?

Indica or Sativa?

http://maryjanesdiary.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/10/effects1.png?e1ffef

I have no issues if they are high on a useful drug like crack.
